name: Jambati
describe: Known for their deep, resonant tones, Jambati bowls are often large with thick walls, displaying visible hammering marks.

name: Thadobati
describe: These bowls are characterized by their straight, high walls and a wide, flat bottom.

name: Remuna
describe: Remuna bowls have a more subtle, inward curving lip and thinner walls, giving them a unique, soft sound profile.

name: Manipuri
describe: Small and shallow, Manipuri singing bowls produce lighter, higher-pitched tones.

name: Lingam
describe: Recognized by the lingam (a protrusion) at the center, these bowls are rare and considered very sacred.

name: Pedestal
describe: Also known as Naga bowls, these have a base or pedestal which they sit on, giving them a goblet-like appearance.

name: Trapezoid
describe: Trapezoid trapezoid bowls have a shape that resembles a trapezoid, with sides that flare out more than typical bowls.

name: Ultabati
describe: Ultabati bowls are known for their exceptionally large size and can produce very low tones akin to the sound of the earth's hum.

name: Crystal
describe: Crystal singing bowls, unlike their metal counterparts, are a relatively modern addition to the sound therapy repertoire, emerging in the late 20th century.
